pull.title: doc: update fuzz instructions when on macOS
pull.body:
Fixes: #31049 

Updates the instructions for fuzzing on macOS to use `lld` instead of `ld`.

Tested instructions on M1 Mac running 14.6.1

events.body:

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage & Benchmarks
For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/31954.
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| ACK | [l0rinc](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31954#issuecomment-2697572586), [brunoerg](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31954#pullrequestreview-2658264313), [hebasto](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31954#pullrequestreview-2658499705) |
| Concept ACK | [jonatack](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31954#issuecomment-2683479174) |
| Stale ACK | [Prabhat1308](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31954#issuecomment-2686348268) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with 👎 to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.

Running the build after these configurations on MacOs 15.3.1 M4 Pro, the fuzz tests are running but I do get these warnings on almost every object being built . Is this expected ?

Concept ACK

Finally fuzzing is working with these changes (tested on M4 Max with Clang 19.1.7), but we're still getting warnings - and a I left a few more suggestions
@Prabhat1308 and @l0rinc, I've updated the instructions to achieve the same goal but without the warnings.

tACK [`725c0fd`](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31954/commits/725c0fd95b15157bd0ec141cc24d27818f536656)

-Checked by running the fuzz tests on several fuzz targets . No warnings displayed now.

events.message:
doc: update fuzz instructions when on macOS

Default linker on macOS does not work with recent versions of LLVM. Updated the instructions for fuzzing to use lld instead.

events.body:
ACK 75486c8ed87a480b9f0c4dc7a10f3cd4eee87b12

Compared to [previous review](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/compare/725c0fd95b15157bd0ec141cc24d27818f536656..75486c8ed87a480b9f0c4dc7a10f3cd4eee87b12#diff-7ff2e1d1ed59fa96766a663236d71bfdd00b4af3321fde39f7dbf022bd968a0a), `APPEND_LDFLAGS` was removed and the description simplified to avoid repetition.

ACK 75486c8ed87a480b9f0c4dc7a10f3cd4eee87b12

I just tested it on macOS 14.3 and worked fine.
ACK 75486c8ed87a480b9f0c4dc7a10f3cd4eee87b12, tested on macOS 15.3.1 (Apple M1) + Clang 19.1.7.

tACK 75486c8ed87a480b9f0c4dc7a10f3cd4eee87b12

Managed to reproduce the issue in `master` (before merge) and this PR fixes it.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -153,13 +153,18 @@ You may also need to take care of giving the correct path for `clang` and
 `clang++`, like `CC=/path/to/clang CXX=/path/to/clang++` if the non-systems
 `clang` does not come first in your path.
 
+Currently the default linker on macOS `ld` does not work with recent versions of `llvm` so you will need to install llvm's linker `lld` and use it with the CXX_FLAG `-fuse-ld=lld`.
comments.body: Can you add a tracking issue here to know when we can safely remove it

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -153,13 +153,18 @@ You may also need to take care of giving the correct path for `clang` and
 `clang++`, like `CC=/path/to/clang CXX=/path/to/clang++` if the non-systems
 `clang` does not come first in your path.
 
+Currently the default linker on macOS `ld` does not work with recent versions of `llvm` so you will need to install llvm's linker `lld` and use it with the CXX_FLAG `-fuse-ld=lld`.
+
 Full configuration step that was tested on macOS with `brew` installed `llvm`:
 
 ```sh
+$ brew install llvm
+$ brew install lld
comments.body:
we can likely do this in a single command:
```suggestion
$ brew install llvm lld
```


We also likely need to remove the command from https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/fuzzing.md?plain=1#L150 now

@@ -153,13 +153,18 @@ You may also need to take care of giving the correct path for `clang` and

 `clang` does not come first in your path.
 
+Currently the default linker on macOS `ld` does not work with recent versions of `llvm` so you will need to install llvm's linker `lld` and use it with the CXX_FLAG `-fuse-ld=lld`.
+
 Full configuration step that was tested on macOS with `brew` installed `llvm`:
comments.body:
This seems to need an update - though I'd just remove the command from the comment:
```suggestion
Full configuration steps:
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -153,13 +153,18 @@ You may also need to take care of giving the correct path for `clang` and
 `clang++`, like `CC=/path/to/clang CXX=/path/to/clang++` if the non-systems
 `clang` does not come first in your path.
 
+Currently the default linker on macOS `ld` does not work with recent versions of `llvm` so you will need to install llvm's linker `lld` and use it with the CXX_FLAG `-fuse-ld=lld`.
+
 Full configuration step that was tested on macOS with `brew` installed `llvm`:
 
 ```sh
+$ brew install llvm
+$ brew install lld
 $ cmake --preset=libfuzzer \
    -DCMAKE_C_COMPILER="$(brew --prefix llvm)/bin/clang" \
    -DCMAKE_CXX_COMPILER="$(brew --prefix llvm)/bin/clang++" \
-   -DAPPEND_LDFLAGS=-Wl,-no_warn_duplicate_libraries
+   -DAPPEND_LDFLAGS=-Wl,-no_warn_duplicate_libraries \
+   -DCMAKE_CXX_FLAGS="-fuse-ld=lld"
comments.body:
I'm getting:
> clang++: warning: argument unused during compilation: '-fuse-ld=lld' [-Wunused-command-line-argument]

 ```sh
+$ brew install llvm
+$ brew install lld

 `clang` does not come first in your path.

+
 Full configuration step that was tested on macOS with `brew` installed `llvm`:

@@ -153,13 +153,18 @@ You may also need to take care of giving the correct path for `clang` and
 `clang++`, like `CC=/path/to/clang CXX=/path/to/clang++` if the non-systems
 `clang` does not come first in your path.
 
+Currently the default linker on macOS `ld` does not work with recent versions of `llvm` so you will need to install llvm's linker `lld` and use it with the CXX_FLAG `-fuse-ld=lld`.
+
 Full configuration step that was tested on macOS with `brew` installed `llvm`:
 
 ```sh
+$ brew install llvm
+$ brew install lld
 $ cmake --preset=libfuzzer \
    -DCMAKE_C_COMPILER="$(brew --prefix llvm)/bin/clang" \
    -DCMAKE_CXX_COMPILER="$(brew --prefix llvm)/bin/clang++" \
-   -DAPPEND_LDFLAGS=-Wl,-no_warn_duplicate_libraries
+   -DAPPEND_LDFLAGS=-Wl,-no_warn_duplicate_libraries \
+   -DCMAKE_CXX_FLAGS="-fuse-ld=lld"

@@ -153,13 +153,18 @@ You may also need to take care of giving the correct path for `clang` and
 `clang++`, like `CC=/path/to/clang CXX=/path/to/clang++` if the non-systems
 `clang` does not come first in your path.
 
+Currently the default linker on macOS `ld` does not work with recent versions of `llvm` so you will need to install llvm's linker `lld` and use it with the CXX_FLAG `-fuse-ld=lld`.
comments.body: Not sure I feel this is big enough to add to the issue list and I would be happy for the docs to be updated when someone notices again that it's not needed any more, especially as this workaround should continue to work in the future even if strictly not needed any more.

+
+Full configuration step for macOS:
comments.body:
It's not exactly *full*, we still need:
```bash
$ cmake --build build_fuzz -j$(nproc)
$ FUZZ=process_message build_fuzz/src/test/fuzz/fuzz
```

comments.body: Technically, it is the full _configuration_ step :)

@@ -153,13 +153,17 @@ You may also need to take care of giving the correct path for `clang` and
 `clang++`, like `CC=/path/to/clang CXX=/path/to/clang++` if the non-systems
 `clang` does not come first in your path.
 
-Full configuration step that was tested on macOS with `brew` installed `llvm`:
+Currently the default linker on macOS `ld` does not work with recent versions of `llvm` so you will need to install llvm's linker `lld` and use it with the CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAG `-fuse-ld=lld`.
+
+Full configuration step for macOS:
 
 ```sh
+$ brew install llvm lld
 $ cmake --preset=libfuzzer \
    -DCMAKE_C_COMPILER="$(brew --prefix llvm)/bin/clang" \
    -DCMAKE_CXX_COMPILER="$(brew --prefix llvm)/bin/clang++" \
-   -DAPPEND_LDFLAGS=-Wl,-no_warn_duplicate_libraries
+   -DAPPEND_LDFLAGS=-Wl,-no_warn_duplicate_libraries \
comments.body: `no_warn_duplicate_libraries` isn't an lld option, so this can be dropped.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -153,13 +153,17 @@ You may also need to take care of giving the correct path for `clang` and
 `clang++`, like `CC=/path/to/clang CXX=/path/to/clang++` if the non-systems
 `clang` does not come first in your path.
 
-Full configuration step that was tested on macOS with `brew` installed `llvm`:
+Currently the default linker on macOS `ld` does not work with recent versions of `llvm` so you will need to install llvm's linker `lld` and use it with the CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAG `-fuse-ld=lld`.
comments.body: Rather than adding text that repeats the code below, we could just say something like: "Using lld is required to due to issues with Apples `ld` and LLVM".

 `clang` does not come first in your path.

+Currently the default linker on macOS `ld` does not work with recent versions of `llvm` so you will need to install llvm's linker `lld` and use it with the CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAG `-fuse-ld=lld`.

@@ -153,13 +153,17 @@ You may also need to take care of giving the correct path for `clang` and
 `clang++`, like `CC=/path/to/clang CXX=/path/to/clang++` if the non-systems
 `clang` does not come first in your path.
 
-Full configuration step that was tested on macOS with `brew` installed `llvm`:
+Currently the default linker on macOS `ld` does not work with recent versions of `llvm` so you will need to install llvm's linker `lld` and use it with the CMAKE_EXE_LINKER_FLAG `-fuse-ld=lld`.
+
+Full configuration step for macOS:
 
 ```sh
+$ brew install llvm lld
 $ cmake --preset=libfuzzer \
    -DCMAKE_C_COMPILER="$(brew --prefix llvm)/bin/clang" \
    -DCMAKE_CXX_COMPILER="$(brew --prefix llvm)/bin/clang++" \
-   -DAPPEND_LDFLAGS=-Wl,-no_warn_duplicate_libraries
+   -DAPPEND_LDFLAGS=-Wl,-no_warn_duplicate_libraries \

@@ -153,13 +153,16 @@ You may also need to take care of giving the correct path for `clang` and
 `clang++`, like `CC=/path/to/clang CXX=/path/to/clang++` if the non-systems
 `clang` does not come first in your path.
 
-Full configuration step that was tested on macOS with `brew` installed `llvm`:
+Using lld is required to due to issues with Apples ld and LLVM.
comments.body:
Typo, maybe something like:
```suggestion
Using `lld` is required due to issues with Apple's `ld` and `LLVM`.
```

+
+Full configuration step for macOS:
 
 ```sh

 $ cmake --preset=libfuzzer \

    -DCMAKE_CXX_COMPILER="$(brew --prefix llvm)/bin/clang++" \
-   -DAPPEND_LDFLAGS=-Wl,-no_warn_duplicate_libraries
+   -DAPPEND_LDFLAGS=-Wl,-no_warn_duplicate_libraries \
comments.body:
Nice, finally we can get rid of that (tested, seems to be working without the warning, good find)!
Should we comment anything on https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/issues/102630?

comments.diff_hunk:

 `clang++`, like `CC=/path/to/clang CXX=/path/to/clang++` if the non-systems
 `clang` does not come first in your path.

gah, taken!

Thanks for the spot.
